title: Add food/supplement category with nut interventions
description: Precomputed interventions have exercise, diet patterns, sleep, substances, medical, stress. Missing: specific foods (nuts, fish, berries), supplements. Add at minimum: daily_nut_consumption, walnut_consumption, fish_twice_weekly.

title: Handle within-category comparisons (A vs B when both positive)
description: User asked 'macadamia vs walnut' - both are healthy. Current system handles 'do X vs don't do X' but not 'X instead of Y'. Should surface: (1) both are good, (2) difference is small (~0.5 QALYs), (3) compliance matters more than the marginal difference.

title: Add explicit prior specification for intervention categories
description: When analyzing novel interventions, the system should use category-level priors. E.g., for any nut, prior should be ~20% mortality reduction (based on meta-analyses of nuts generally). The prior dominates when nut-specific evidence is sparse. Need to formalize prior specification per category.

title: Improve Bayesian reasoning: evidence quality affects CI width, not point estimate
description: Case study: Comparing nut health effects showed that sparse evidence (macadamias) shouldn't lower point estimates, only widen CIs. Currently the system may penalize interventions with less research. Fix: evidenceQuality should affect simulation variance, not the central tendency of mechanism effects.
